mods.note: 0 (AUjiaWlulla cSaU TELEPHONES: OFFICE 449 RESIDENCE 257-206 KUWAIT.... ^ C ' » 1 Dear Mr. Gethin, n jc- uJ With reference to your Memorandum No. M/190(4/V5) of 17th instant I would like to inform you that Derovan Kayunchi has already been contacted and instructed to proceed to Baghdad to see the Syrian Minister there, but he states that his passport is with the Political Agency for a transit visa for Iraq. n (tii tmA. I shall be glad if you will grant him the necessary visas so that he may proceed to Baghdad without further delay. Mr. J.Gethin, Political Agency, Kuwait.“Ho ,M/ 190 ( 4 / 45 ) ?Olit 'iuwaibf 0nCy ’ 17th December,1949. Will you plaane refer to letter IJo.!V6/3916 9 ^ December from Hia Hitiibneaa the Ruler to the Political ? 2. I should be very ^rateful if you could confirm that it has been possible to carry out His Highness* instructions and that Derovan Kayunchi has been traced and informed of the request ot the Syrian Minister in Ballad. Abdulla Mulla Saleh, MBE., Kuwait.No.^ 7 7-(4/4P) S-0 The Political Agency, Kuwait. 19th Noverrber, 1949 Dear Chancery, We enclose herewith a copy of a telegrarr No. Misc/283 that we sent to you on the 7th November concerning a request received from the Syrian Legation in Baghdad about De Rovan Kouyourcji. The action we took was to ask the local authorities to tell the man in question, if he could be found, that the Syrian Legation wanted him. We said nothing about arrest as it seemed to us completely ultra vires . If the Syrian Legation could give us the man's address or the place of his employ ment we might stand a better chance of finding him. Meanwhile would you be good enough to explain the circurrstances to the Syrian Legation and tell them that you ar*e the proper channel for making any future requests for our services ? Yours ever, Kuwait', Chancery, British Embassy, Baghdad.Telegram En Clair. Erom Political, Kuwait. To Prodrome, Baghdad. Tel. No. Misc/283. Dated 7th November, l'^49. PRIORITY. I have received following telegram No. 137 of November 5th from Syrian Legation, Baghdad begins ,f Syrian Legation Baghdad requests you to inform De Rovan Kouyoumji to call at this Legation at onee. On refusal he may be sent under arrest. rT Ends. I am approaching local authorities but suggest Legation should address to you any future requests. IAKINS7 > * r . Telegram / Enclair i’rom SYHIAN, Baghdad To British Adviser, Kuwait No. 137 Dated the 5th received the 7th Novel her, *49. Most Immediate. Syrian Legation Baghdad requests you to inform DE B07AN AOUYOUMJI to call at this Legation at once. On refusal he may be sent under arrest. SYRIAN✓ I

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 9; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. Two additional foliation sequences are present in parallel between ff 2-8 and ff 7-8; the first sequence of numbers are written in pencil whereas the second sequence is written in pen; neither sequence is circled. A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials in Kuwait and Iraq, as well as the Ruler of Kuwait, Shaikh Ahmad al-Jaber al-Sabah and his Secretary, Abdullah Mulla Saleh, regarding the whereabouts of a Syrian national named De Rovan Kouyoumji (also written in the file as Derovan Kayunchi). The correspondence with Shaikh Ahmad is in Arabic, accompanied by English translations.
